body_html:
It's a common way to export and import symbol in VC++.
Look at this code:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/platform/macros.h

Lines 59 to 65 in d89cf13

// Control visiblity outside .so
#if defined(COMPILER_MSVC)
#ifdef TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY
#define TF_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport)
#else
#define TF_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport)
#endif // TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY

TF_EXPORT is used here:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/types.h

Lines 73 to 75 in f5f2f78

TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU; // "CPU"
TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU; // "GPU"
TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL; // "SYCL"

We define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY when building code for _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so, and undefine it when building contrib ops, so that symbols can be exported and imported correctly.

We also do it in CMake build in AddUserOps function

tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_cc_ops.cmake

Lines 182 to 186 in 79422ab

# make sure TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY is not defined for this target
get_target_property(target_compile_flags ${_AT_TARGET} COMPILE_FLAGS)
if(target_compile_flags STREQUAL "target_compile_flags-NOTFOUND")
if (WIN32)
set(target_compile_flags "/UTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY")

Related: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8863193/what-does-declspecdllimport-really-mean
body_text:
It's a common way to export and import symbol in VC++.
Look at this code:

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/core/platform/macros.h
    
    
        Lines 59 to 65
      in
      d89cf13
    
    
    
    

        
          
           // Control visiblity outside .so 
        

        
          
           #if defined(COMPILER_MSVC) 
        

        
          
           #ifdef TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY 
        

        
          
           #define TF_EXPORT __declspec(dllexport) 
        

        
          
           #else 
        

        
          
           #define TF_EXPORT __declspec(dllimport) 
        

        
          
           #endif  // TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY 
        
    
  


TF_EXPORT is used here:

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/types.h
    
    
        Lines 73 to 75
      in
      f5f2f78
    
    
    
    

        
          
           TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_CPU;   // "CPU" 
        

        
          
           TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_GPU;   // "GPU" 
        

        
          
           TF_EXPORT extern const char* const DEVICE_SYCL;  // "SYCL" 
        
    
  


We define TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY when building code for _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so, and undefine it when building contrib ops, so that symbols can be exported and imported correctly.
We also do it in CMake build in AddUserOps function

  
    
      tensorflow/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_cc_ops.cmake
    
    
        Lines 182 to 186
      in
      79422ab
    
    
    
    

        
          
           # make sure TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY is not defined for this target 
        

        
          
           get_target_property(target_compile_flags  ${_AT_TARGET} COMPILE_FLAGS) 
        

        
          
           if(target_compile_flags STREQUAL "target_compile_flags-NOTFOUND") 
        

        
          
             if (WIN32) 
        

        
          
               set(target_compile_flags "/UTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY") 
        
    
  


Related: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8863193/what-does-declspecdllimport-really-mean
body:
It's a common way to export and import symbol in VC++.
Look at this code:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/d89cf1347405e36ada4eb09be809c3c7ac01d451/tensorflow/core/platform/macros.h#L59-L65

`TF_EXPORT` is used here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/f5f2f789ea395e585ddcbc43e088fa63d6b41d0e/tensorflow/core/framework/types.h#L73-L75

We define `TF_COMPILE_LIBRARY` when building code for `_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so`, and undefine it when building contrib ops, so that symbols can be exported and imported correctly.

We also do it in CMake build in AddUserOps function
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/79422ab39b5fe0e1491abb8deabc7ecb5fd9f3a2/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/tf_cc_ops.cmake#L182-L186

Related: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8863193/what-does-declspecdllimport-really-mean
